docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: The RPG++ Engine is an experimental engine for 2D RPG games.

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
• raylib
  • nlohmann/json
  • nativefiledialog-extended
  • raygui
  • alpaca
  • sol2
  • reproc

docs.title: Sections
docs.text: • C++ API

docs.title: Building
docs.text:
Clone the repository 

git clone https://github.com/CDevv/rpgpp

Build it using Xmake. You must download it 

xmake

Then you can run it. 

./editor

docs.title: RPG++ Library
docs.text: A C++ Library for building RPG games with the power of raylib.

docs.title: Types
docs.text: Name Description WorldService The WorldService is responsible for containing and drawing the Room. TileSet The TileSet class represents a collection of tiles that can be used for a TileMap or another object  See :    TileMap Direction Direction enum, representing an animation state. Actor The Actor class represents an Actor in the game's world. AtlasTile Represents a source atlas tile from a TileSet. CollisionsContainer A container of collision tiles to be used by a Room InteractablesContainer Container of Interactables that is to be used by a Room InteractableType ENum for interactable types Interactable Defines an object that is interactable in-game by a player's action InterfaceService The InterfaceService acts for the User Interface (UI). Player THe Player class represents the player character that the player controls. Room This class represents a game's room. StateService The StateService is responsible for storing gameplay-related variables that make up the state of the game. Tile A tile that may be placed in the world. TileMap A TileMap represents a map of the placed tiles in a Room.

docs.title: Direction
docs.text:
enum Direction

Direction enum, representing an animation state.

RPGPP_DOWN_IDLE = 0 Down Idle state. RPGPP_DOWN = 1 Down state. RPGPP_UP_IDLE = 2 Up Idle state. RPGPP_UP = 3 Up state. RPGPP_LEFT_IDLE = 4 Left Idle state. RPGPP_LEFT = 5 Left state. RPGPP_RIGHT_IDLE = 6 Right Idle state. RPGPP_RIGHT = 7 Right state.
